page.title: 13HOUSING, HEMEL HEMPSTEAD
page.content: {Housing}in the area is a mixture of {rented}and{private.}In the new part of the town the houses were built by the New Town's Commission (wound up about 1980) and the Council. Many of these are now privately owned. Adeyfield, Gadebridge, Warners End and Highfield are more established {neighbourhoods}of the new town, but Grovehill and Woodhall Farm are still expanding. The majority of the housing is {terraced,}but there are many {semi-detached}and{detached}houses. There are also several{low rise blocks {of flats}and{maisonettes,}but few {tower blocks. {Older properties}(mainly Victorian) are to be found in old Hemel Hempstead and off the Marlowes.
